Day 9: Auto buy authors

I would say in all my collection the only author I currently buy books without reading the description is Rick Riordan, I love the Percy Jackson books so much I had to buy the Heroes of Olympus when they came out. But I am trying to diversify in terms as authors go, so is there any book that you recommend me?? Please comment your suggestion.

What is your favorite auto buy author?

"Jack?” Paige said. 
To her surprise, Jack looked into Reese’s face. He smiled. She couldn’t tell if it was real, but it didn’t matter. He tried to smile for her, tried to fight past the ache, the ever-foreboding that was deep like the endless abyss; the darkness without escape. “Goodnight, sweetheart. See you tomorrow,” Jack said. 
Reese smiled back. “I’m going to be okay, Daddy,” Reese said.  Jack stared. He stared like he was gazing deep into a cadaver. “I know,” he said, “I know, sweetheart. I love you. See you tomorrow.” Reese turned and went to the stairs. It did not seem odd in that moment, but Jack refused to rise and hug her. No one thought about that until later, much later when it was too late. Almost too late. That Jack refused to rise and embrace his daughter.As she climbed the stairs, The Medicine Man spoke to her from the landing. It was dark there and his black overcoat and wide-brimmed hat played in different shades of darkness and shadow.“Now I’ll lay thee down to sleep,” he said.  Reese went up the stairs, almost happy he was here. She was happy he would help her sleep when he injected her. “Pray to me, you’re soul I’ll keep,” The Medicine Mancontinued. 
She got to the landing, turned to the left and took the final six stairs, almost two at a time.“You won’t die before you wake. I promise you won’t be the one I take,” he finished.She went up the stairs, walking ahead of him. Wherever Reese went, The Medicine Man followed.
-- from 'LAVENDER BLUE'. My new horror novel that releases this week on #amazonpublishing in #kindle and #paperback versions! All week I'll be sharing the photos from the book. All these pictures are placed into both the e-book and the paperback. Stop by, say hi and #staybrutal my friends! #whattoread #writersofinstagram #followmyig #newnovel

Good Morning, Lovelies 😘❤ My second collection of poetry, Phoenixes Groomed as Genesis Doves.
I touch on various topics and play with a few poetic devices and forms. 
The flow of PGAGD is like a journey. Naive, immature, and rockin' rose colored glasses. Gradually the voice challenges the life they know and  matures.
They experience life with its own lens rather than the lens  of others.
Click the link in the bio for more.

Today's vintage paperback cover: Tarzan and the Lost Empire by Edgar Rice Burroughs 
Artist: Unknown 
One of only two Dell Edgar Rice Burroughs paperbacks, this edition features a very Johnny Weissmuller-ish Tarzan on the cover. This also features one of Dell's famous "Mapback" covers, which is ... well, a map (connected to the story) on the back cover.

For the month of May, I'm showcasing paperback books from my personal collection. I started seriously collecting vintage paperbacks about a year and a half ago. I collect various authors, characters, cover artists, and just great covers: quirky, action-packed, evocative, and beautiful. Join me each day, won't you, for another cover. 
#paperback #vintage #vintagepaperback #paperbackcover #garyspaperbackcoveroftheday #bookstagram #tarzan #edgarriceburroughs #erb

We have a #BookFairyChallenge photo from York, UK!
・・・
A book fairy has dropped a copy of The Unmumsy Mum outside York Minster with Emperor Constantine.
Constantine came to Britain with his father, the emperor Constantius, in 305AD.  Constantius died in July the following year in York.

The system of succession at the time demanded that another Caesar should become emperor but the soldiers in York immediately proclaimed Constantine their leader.  It proved to be a pivotal moment in history.  He is known as Constantine the Great for very good reasons.

After nearly 80 years, and three generations of political fragmentation, Constantine united the whole of the Roman Empire under one ruler.  By 324 he had extended his power and was sole emperor, restoring stability and security to the Roman world. For more information on Constantine and his connection to York follow the link in @rose_and_rae's bio 😀 #ibelieveinbookfairies

#york #yorkminster #constantine #history #england #englishhistory #uk #unitedkingdom #romanhistory #roman #solidaritea

"Orange is the early morning sun stretching across the sky and the color of a burning ember standing tall in the middle of a beach bonfire. It’s leaves in the fall, carrots in Nana’s vegetable soup on a cold winter day, tulips in the spring, and the ladybugs in the middle of the grassy park on a hot summer afternoon. Orange is life. It’s unexpected but beautiful."
Aly Martinez

Life of Pi is so popular with book fairies! Can you spot this copy at San Diego Zoo this afternoon? 
About the book:

Life of Pi is a Canadian adventure novel by Yann Martel published in 2001. The protagonist is Piscine Molitor "Pi" Patel, an Indian boy from Pondicherry who explores issues of spirituality and practicality from an early age. He survives 227 days after a shipwreck while stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.

About the location:

The San Diego Zoo is a zoo in Balboa Park, San Diego, California, housing over 3,700 animals of more than 650 species and subspecies. Its parent organization, San Diego Zoo Global, is one of the largest zoological membership associations in the world, with more than 250,000 member households and 130,000 child memberships, representing more than a half million people. The San Diego Zoo was a pioneer in the concept of open-air, cageless exhibits that re-create natural animal habitats. It is one of the few zoos in the world that houses and successfully breeds the giant panda. In 2013, the zoo added a new Koalafornia Adventure exhibit, providing an updated Australian animal experience. 2017 will see the opening of Africa Rocks.

Thanks to book fairy Lisa for leaving this gift and sending us a pic on twitter! If you want to join in, head to 💚www.ibelieveinbookfairies.com 💚
